data.title: Time Traveler
data.solution:
years=list(map(int,input().split()))
n=int(input())
sy=years[0]
tab=[]
for i in range(n):
    jump=int(input())
    tab.append(jump)

tab=sorted(tab)[::-1]
stock=[]
index=0
count=0
while years[0]>years[1] and index<len(tab):
    if years[0]-tab[index]>=years[1]:
        years[0]-=tab[index]
        count+=1
    else:
        stock.append(count)
        index+=1
        count=0
if index==len(tab):
    stock[index-1]+=1
else:
    stock.append(count)

while len(stock)<len(tab):
    stock.append(0)
print(sum(stock))
for i,l in enumerate(stock):
    sy-=l*tab[i]
    print(l,tab[i],sy)
data.statement:
Your time machine is currently at the year [[X]], and you need to travel back in time to the year [[Y]]. However, the time warp technology is experimental and unstable, making it difficult to pinpoint precise destinations. You can only move the number of years in certain given intervals [[inter]].

Write a program that calculates the minimum number of time jumps required to reach the year [[Y]] from the year [[X]], given the following rules:

- You can perform jumps to previous years only (no traveling into the future).
- You can only jump back in time in intervals of [[inter]]
- Your task is to find the most efficient combination of jumps that will get you to the year [[Y]] in the least jumps possible.

NB: If you can't reach the exact [[Y]] date you want, take the value below it that is closest to [[Y]] (i.e. go further back in time if you can't arrive perfectly).
data.stubGenerator:
read X:int Y:int
read n:int
loop n read inter:int
write output
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two space separated integers [[X]] and [[Y]] for starting year and destination
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of possible jumps
<<Next [[N]] lines :>> [[inter]] possible jumps
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> The total numbers of jumps made
<<Next [[N]] lines :>> Three space separated integers representing <<number of jumps>>, <<how many years per jump>> and <<year after those jumps>> sorted in descending order of years per jump.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your time machine is currently at the year X, and you need to travel back in time to the year Y. However, the time warp technology is experimental and unstable, making it difficult to pinpoint precise destinations. You can only move the number of years in certain given intervals inter.

Write a program that calculates the minimum number of time jumps required to reach the year Y from the year X, given the following rules:

- You can perform jumps to previous years only (no traveling into the future).
- You can only jump back in time in intervals of inter
- Your task is to find the most efficient combination of jumps that will get you to the year Y in the least jumps possible.

NB: If you can't reach the exact Y date you want, take the value below it that is closest to Y (i.e. go further back in time if you can't arrive perfectly).
Input
Line 1: Two space separated integers X and Y for starting year and destination
Line 2: An integer N for the number of possible jumps
Next N lines : inter possible jumps
Output
Line 1 : The total numbers of jumps made
Next N lines : Three space separated integers representing number of jumps, how many years per jump and year after those jumps sorted in descending order of years per jump.
Constraints
X>Y
Example
Input
2000 1000
3
300
200
100
Output
4
3 300 1100
0 200 1100
1 100 1000
